item.title: Problem with commands [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:10, topic:534185”][quote author=Damoiscool link=topic=652979.msg4376656#msg4376656 date=1382241886]
Can someone close this thread? Help is no longer needed.
[/quote]
There is no need to bury a thread where others might find help from.[/quote]

That is true. But what help would this give? I got no help from the thread at all, I had to use an older commands.java I had backed up. So really I have no idea what I had screwed up in the first place because, I added the same command to the backup and got no errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with commands [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

show me line 458 in commands.java… your error is there, it is trying to access a 3rd value in your array, which doesnt exist. Your try catch idea is bad programming >_< you should try to avoid errors in the first place, rather than ignoring them.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with commands [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Damoiscool:

Well I’m confused, there is no shop = 2 and I know that, but the thing is I never entered a 2 when I typed the command and I never put a 2 when I added the command to commands.java.

Then you did something wrong.
This is my open shop command:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("openshop")) { try{ int id = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.split(" ")[1]); c.getShops().openShop(id); }catch(Exception e){ c.sendMessage("Use as: ::openshop shopid"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with commands [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Damoiscool:

Hmm none of those worked, I found a backup commands.java I had used and replaced it. Fixed the problem but I dont know what was wrong, I’m suspecting I may have accidentally deleted one of the imports.

No, there was nothing wrong with the imports, it’d give a different error.
You need a try and catch block to prevent errors like this from happening.
You can check your shops.cfg and see if shop = 2 is in there. If not, that’s your error.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

First, to stop this error, use a try catch…
Second, it’s because the shop id (2) doesn’t exist…

item.title: Problem with commands [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

Ok so I added this ::shop command

if(playerCommand.startsWith("openshop") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Damo")) { int shop = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(9)); c.getShops().openShop(shop); }

Everything compiled etc. But when I tried to use it I got this error and nothing happened?.. Quite confused as too why this is happening…

The command I got from here… http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/help/267947-pi-openshop-pi.html

I have tried searching for others but found nothing of help. I also tried changing the command as well as using the other ones in that thread. If you’re only going to comment on how stupid I am or flame me in some way, don’t bother.

Read full topic
